708178f-a.text:
N. E. corner of Fourth Avenue and 11th Street.
February 12, 1931.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer,

711069f-b.text:
(1)
107-109 East 11th Street, north side, east of Fourth Avenue.
April 6, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same site after demolition for the new U. S. Post Office to be  erected here. Vacant space shown between buildings was formerly
No. 108 East 12th Street.
June 27, i936
P. L. Sperr.

711069f-a.text:
(1)
107-109 East 11th Street, north side, east of Fourth Avenue.
April 6, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same site after demolition for the new U. S. Post Office to be  erected here. Vacant space shown between buildings was formerly

June 27, i936

711080f-a.text:
(1)
East 11th Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Fourth Ave. Arched building shown, at the edge of demolition for the new United States Post Office, is St. Ann's Parochial School. The adjoining building with a marquee is Webster Hall.
March 17, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, slightly later. Note exposed side of the church proper
(112-124 East 12th Street).
June 27, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

711080f-b.text:
(1)
East 11th Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Fourth Ave. Arched building shown, at the edge of demolition for the new United States Post Office, is St. Ann's Parochial School. The adjoining building with a marquee is Webster Hall.
March 17, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, slightly later. Note exposed side of the church proper
(112-124 East 12th Street).
June 27, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

708179f-a.text:
Fourth Ave., south from East 11th Street to Cooper Square and showing at that point the Third Ave. Elevated Line on the Bowery. The large 5-story block front building, shown on the right is the north unit of Wanamakers. The gothic type structures on the extreme right are the
Choir House and Hall of Grace P.E. Church.
May 7, 1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.

708180f-a.text:
Fourth Ave., at the N.E. corner of East 11th Street, showing the new Post Office, Station "D" that formerly occupied the building at the S.W. corner of Fourth Ave. and East 13th Street.
August 12, 1937.
George D. Chinn.

708177f-a.text:
Fourth Ave., at the N.E. corner of East 11th Street. Note demolition of Nos. 93-99. A new United States Post Offioe will rise here.
March 17, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
